    		Virtual Advising and Events
    	General Contact InformationInternational Admissions and Outreach+1 530 898 5415apply@csuchico.eduVirtual Advising on ZoomDrop-in Advising Future Student Advising - I have not yet submitted an application International Admissions is excited to offer Virtual Drop-in Advising. Future students and counselors/advisors can virtually “drop-in” to ask an admissions team member about the application, degree options, university community, and anything else related to applying to CSU, Chico.  Advising HoursAdvising hoursTuesday8:00AM - 10:00AMPST/PDTThursday10:00AM - 12:00PMPST/PDT Where: Join us in Zoom - https://csuchico.zoom.us/my/apply(opens in new window)Schedule an Admissions Advising AppointmentI have submitted an Undergraduate application When:*Monday: 12:00-2:00 PM (PST/PDT)Tuesday: 9:00-11:00 AM (PST/PDT)Wednesday: 5:00-6:00 PM (PST/PDT) (Overseas students only)Thursday: 12:00-2:00 PM (PST/PDT)Where: Make an appointment (opens in new window)I have submitted a Graduate application When:*Monday: 8:30-10:30 AM (PST/PDT)Tuesday/Thursday: 1:00-3:00 PM (PST/PDT)Where: Please email Ms. Snow Sun: ysun6@csuchico.edu to schedule a virtual advising appointment. * Advising will not take place during holidays when the university is closed. For the 2022-23 academic year, those days include:July 4August 16 - new international student orientationSeptember 5 November 11November 24-25December 26-30January 2January 16March 31May 29 Talk to an International Student Ambassador
                        Find Your Time Zone
                    All times listed in PST/PDT.  Please use the Time Zone Calculator(opens in new window)  to find the equivalent time in your time zone.International Education & Global EngagementStudent Services Center, Room 440+1-530-898-5415iege@csuchico.eduwww.csuchico.edu/iegeDivisions of IEGEInternational AdmissionsInternational Student & Scholar ServicesStudy Abroad & ExchangeESL Support ServicesFaculty ResourcesInternational Training Programs
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
